blocks.name: phplem1
blocks.content: Lemma for Pigeonhole Principle. If we join a natural number to itself minus an element, we end up with its successor minus the same element. (Contributed by NM, 25-May-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm phplem1(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0)), wceq(cun(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))))
} = {
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0)), wceq(cun(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c1)), emptycls))
  sylan(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c1)), emptycls), word(c0))
  nnord(c0)
  syl(wa(word(c0), wcel(c1, c0)), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c1)), emptycls), wne(c0, c1))
  nordeq(c0, c1)
  disjsn2(c0, c1)
  syl6eqr(cun(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1)), cdif(cun(csn(c0), c0), csn(c1)), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c1)), emptycls))
  undif4(csn(c0), csn(c1), c0)
  difeq1i(csuc(c0), csn(c1), cun(csn(c0), c0))
  equncomi(csuc(c0), csn(c0), c0)
  df-suc(c0)
}

thm phplem1(class c0, class c1) {
  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ _om âˆ§ c1 âˆˆ c0)â†’({ c0 } â‹ƒ(c0 \ { c1 }))=(suc(c0)\ { c1 }))
} = {
  syl((c0 âˆˆ _om âˆ§ c1 âˆˆ c0), ({ c0 } â‹ƒ(c0 \ { c1 }))=(suc(c0)\ { c1 }), ({ c0 } â‹‚ { c1 })= âˆ…)
  sylan(c0 âˆˆ _om, c1 âˆˆ c0, ({ c0 } â‹‚ { c1 })= âˆ…, Ord(c0))
  nnord(c0)
  syl((Ord(c0)âˆ§ c1 âˆˆ c0), ({ c0 } â‹‚ { c1 })= âˆ…, c0 â‰  c1)
  nordeq(c0, c1)
  disjsn2(c0, c1)
  syl6eqr(({ c0 } â‹ƒ(c0 \ { c1 })), (suc(c0)\ { c1 }), (({ c0 } â‹ƒ c0)\ { c1 }), ({ c0 } â‹‚ { c1 })= âˆ…)
  undif4({ c0 }, { c1 }, c0)
  difeq1i(suc(c0), { c1 }, ({ c0 } â‹ƒ c0))
  equncomi(suc(c0), { c0 }, c0)
  df-suc(c0)
}

blocks.name: phplem2
blocks.content: Lemma for Pigeonhole Principle. A natural number is equinumerous to its successor minus one of its elements. (Contributed by NM, 11-Jun-1998.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm phplem2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0)), wbr(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  3brtr3d(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1)), cun(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), cun(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0), wbr(cun(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), cen, cun(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, com), wbr(cun(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), cen, cun(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))), wa(wbr(csn(c1), cen, csn(c0)), wbr(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cen, cdif(c0, csn(c1)))), wa(wceq(cin(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), emptycls), wceq(cin(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), emptycls)))
  pm3.2i(wbr(csn(c1), cen, csn(c0)), wbr(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cen, cdif(c0, csn(c1))))
  mp2an(wbr(csn(c1), cen, csn(c0)), wcel(csn(cop(c1, c0)), universe), wf1o(csn(cop(c1, c0)), csn(c1), csn(c0)))
  snex(cop(c1, c0))
  f1osn(c1, c0)
  f1oen3g(csn(cop(c1, c0)), universe, csn(c1), csn(c0))
  enref(cdif(c0, csn(c1)))
  difexi(c0, csn(c1))
  jctil(wcel(c0, com), wceq(cin(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), emptycls), wceq(cin(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), emptycls))
  syl5eq(cin(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), emptycls, cin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c0)), wcel(c0, com))
  incom(csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, com), wceq(cin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c0)), emptycls), wss(cin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c0)), emptycls))
  syl5sseq(cin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c0)), emptycls, cin(c0, csn(c0)), wcel(c0, com))
  ax-mp(wss(cin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c0)), cin(c0, csn(c0))), wss(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), c0))
  difss(c0, csn(c1))
  ssrin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), c0, csn(c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, com), wceq(cin(c0, csn(c0)), emptycls), word(c0))
  nnord(c0)
  orddisj(c0)
  ss0(cin(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c0)))
  disjdif(csn(c1), c0)
  unen(csn(c1), csn(c0), cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0), wceq(cun(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), c0))
  syl5eq(cun(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), c0, cun(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), wcel(c1, c0))
  uncom(csn(c1), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))
  difsnid(c1, c0)
  phplem1(c0, c1)
}

  difexi(c0, { c1 })

  incom({ c0 }, (c0 \ { c1 }))
  syl(c0 âˆˆ _om, ((c0 \ { c1 })â‹‚ { c0 })= âˆ…, ((c0 \ { c1 })â‹‚ { c0 })âŠ† âˆ…)
  syl5sseq(((c0 \ { c1 })â‹‚ { c0 }), emptycls, (c0 â‹‚ { c0 }), c0 âˆˆ _om)
  ax-mp(((c0 \ { c1 })â‹‚ { c0 })âŠ†(c0 â‹‚ { c0 }), (c0 \ { c1 })âŠ† c0)
  difss(c0, { c1 })
  ssrin((c0 \ { c1 }), c0, { c0 })
  syl(c0 âˆˆ _om, (c0 â‹‚ { c0 })= âˆ…, Ord(c0))
  nnord(c0)
  orddisj(c0)
  ss0(((c0 \ { c1 })â‹‚ { c0 }))
  disjdif({ c1 }, c0)
  unen({ c1 }, { c0 }, (c0 \ { c1 }), (c0 \ { c1 }))
  adantl(c0 âˆˆ _om, c1 âˆˆ c0, ({ c1 } â‹ƒ(c0 \ { c1 }))= c0)
  syl5eq(({ c1 } â‹ƒ(c0 \ { c1 })), c0, ((c0 \ { c1 })â‹ƒ { c1 }), c1 âˆˆ c0)
  uncom({ c1 }, (c0 \ { c1 }))
  difsnid(c1, c0)
  phplem1(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: phplem3
blocks.content: Lemma for Pigeonhole Principle. A natural number is equinumerous to its successor minus any element of the successor. (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm phplem3(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, csuc(c0))), wbr(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  sylan2(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, csuc(c0)), wbr(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))), wo(wcel(c1, c0), wceq(c1, c0)))
  elsuci(c1, c0)
  jaodan(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0), wceq(c1, c0), wbr(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))))
  phplem2(c0, c1)
  syl5breq(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1)), c0, wa(wcel(c0, com), wceq(c1, c0)))
  enref(c0)
  sylan9eq(c0, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1)), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0)), wcel(c0, com), wceq(c1, c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, com), wceq(c0, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0))), word(c0))
  nnord(c0)
  orddif(c0)
  eqcoms(c1, c0, wceq(cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0)), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c1))))
  difeq2d(csuc(c0), csn(c0), csn(c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  sneq(c0, c1)
}

thm phplem3(class c0, class c1) {

blocks.name: phplem4
blocks.content: Lemma for Pigeonhole Principle. Equinumerosity of successors implies equinumerosity of the original natural numbers. (Contributed by NM, 28-May-1998.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm phplem4(class c0, class c1) {

  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  syl5bi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(csuc(c0), cen, csuc(c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wex(hs0, wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))))
  bren(hs0, csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  exlimdv(hs0, wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  anandirs(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  syl2an(wa(wcel(c0, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wa(wcel(c1, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wbr(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0)))), wbr(cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), cen, c1))
  breqtrd(c0, cen, cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), cima(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wcel(c0, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))))
  ensymd(c0, cima(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wcel(c0, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))))
  sylancl(wa(wcel(c0, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wbr(cima(cv(hs0), c0), cen, c0), wf1(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wcel(csuc(c1), universe))
  adantl(wcel(c0, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wf1(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  f1of1(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  sucex(c1)
  mpanr12(wa(wf1(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wcel(csuc(c1), universe)), wbr(cima(cv(hs0), c0), cen, c0), wss(c0, csuc(c0)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sssucid(c0)
  f1imaen2g(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1), universe, c0)
  sylan9eq(cima(cv(hs0), c0), cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), cima(cv(hs0), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0))), wcel(c0, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  imaeq2d(cv(hs0), c0, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0)), wcel(c0, com))
  syl(wcel(c0, com), wceq(c0, cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0))), word(c0))
  nnord(c0)
  orddif(c0)
  3eqtr4rd(cima(cv(hs0), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0))), cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), cdif(cima(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), cdif(cima(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), cima(cv(hs0), csn(c0))), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  difeq2d(cima(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0)), cima(cv(hs0), csn(c0)), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  sylancl(wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wceq(csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0)), cima(cv(hs0), csn(c0))), wfn(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wcel(c0, csuc(c0)))
  fnsnfv(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), c0)
  difeq1d(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0)), cima(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  3eqtr3a(csuc(c1), cima(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), crn(cv(hs0)), cima(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0))), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  eqcomi(crn(cv(hs0)), cima(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0))))
  imadmrn(cv(hs0))
  syl(wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wceq(crn(cv(hs0)), csuc(c1)), wfo(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  imaeq2d(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0)), csuc(c0), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  f1odm(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  simplbiim(wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wceq(cima(cv(hs0), cdif(csuc(c0), csn(c0))), cdif(cima(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), cima(cv(hs0), csn(c0)))), wfo(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs0))))
  dff1o3(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  imadif(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csn(c0))
  ensymd(cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), c1, wa(wcel(c1, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))))
  sylan2(wcel(c1, com), wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wbr(c1, cen, cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0)))), wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), csuc(c1)))
  mpbid(wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), csuc(c1)), wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), crn(cv(hs0))))
  sylancl(wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), crn(cv(hs0))), wfn(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wcel(c0, csuc(c0)))
  f1ofn(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  sucid(c0)
  fnfvelrn(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), c0)
  syl(wf1o(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wb(wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), crn(cv(hs0))), wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), csuc(c1))), wfo(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  f1ofo(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  eleq2d(cfv(cv(hs0), c0), crn(cv(hs0)), csuc(c1), wfo(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))
  forn(cv(hs0), csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  phplem3(c1, cfv(cv(hs0), c0))
  fvex(cv(hs0), c0)
  entr(c0, cdif(csuc(c1), csn(cfv(cv(hs0), c0))), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(csuc(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(csuc(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)))
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, cen, c1))
}

blocks.name: nneneq
blocks.content: Two equinumerous natural numbers are equal. Proposition 10.20 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 90 and its converse. Also compare Corollary 6E of [Enderton] p. 136. (Contributed by NM, 28-May-1998.)

blocks.name: php
blocks.content: Pigeonhole Principle. A natural number is not equinumerous to a proper subset of itself. Theorem (Pigeonhole Principle) of [Enderton] p. 134. The theorem is so-called because you can't put _n_ + 1 pigeons into _n_ holes (if each hole holds only one pigeon). The proof consists of lemmas ~ phplem1 through ~ phplem4 , ~ nneneq , and this final piece of the proof. (Contributed by NM, 29-May-1998.)

blocks.name: php4
blocks.content: Corollary of the Pigeonhole Principle ~ php : a natural number is strictly dominated by its successor. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm php4(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, csdm, csuc(c0)))

blocks.name: php5
blocks.content: Corollary of the Pigeonhole Principle ~ php : a natural number is not equinumerous to its successor. Corollary 10.21(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2004.)

blocks.name: snnen2o
blocks.content: A singleton ` { A } ` is never equinumerous with the ordinal number 2. This holds for proper singletons ( ` A e. _V ` ) as well as for singletons being the empty set ( ` A e/ _V ` ). (Contributed by AV, 6-Aug-2019.)
blocks.origin:
